_A_TABS_COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION_: The ATabs component is used for organizing content through tabs. Each tab contains a title and corresponding content, which is displayed when the tab is activated. Various settings are supported, such as vertical or horizontal layout, disabling tabs, allowing HTML in titles, and controlling the behavior of the active tab.
_A_TABS_EVENTS_CHANGE_DESCRIPTION_: The event triggered when a tab is clicked. Returns an object with the following arguments: $event — event information, tab — tab data, tabId — unique identifier for the tab or its index, index — the tab's index in the data array.
_A_TABS_GROUP_ACTIVE_TAB_ID_DESCRIPTION_: This example demonstrates how to use active-tab-id to set the active tab upon rendering. The value of active-tab-id can be an ID if key-id is used, or the tab's index if key-id is not defined. The component automatically watches for changes in this property.
_A_TABS_GROUP_ACTIVE_TAB_ID_HEADER_: Setting active tab by ID or index
_A_TABS_GROUP_COMPLEX_DESCRIPTION_: This example demonstrates how to use the a-tabs component with various settings, including the ability to add or remove tabs. The form allows changes to parameters such as disabling tabs, arranging them vertically or horizontally, toggling the border around active tabs, and using HTML for tab titles. Additionally, it implements dynamic tab addition and deletion.
_A_TABS_GROUP_COMPLEX_HEADER_: Example with settings and tab management
_A_TABS_GROUP_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use disabled to disable all tabs. When set to true, users cannot interact with the tabs.
_A_TABS_GROUP_DYNAMIC_SLOTS_DESCRIPTION_: This example demonstrates how to use dynamic slots slotTab and slotContent, where the names are specified in the data array. If a name and the corresponding slot are provided, they will replace the default tab and content. Slot arguments provide access to activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
_A_TABS_GROUP_DYNAMIC_SLOTS_HEADER_: Dynamic slots for tabs and content
_A_TABS_GROUP_IS_BOXED_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use is-boxed to determine whether a border will be displayed around the active tab. The first example has the border enabled, and the second one has it disabled.
_A_TABS_GROUP_IS_CHANGE_OUTSIDE_DESCRIPT: This example shows how to use is-change-outside. When set to true, clicking on an inactive tab will not automatically activate it. Instead, the change event and the active-tab-id property must be used to change the active tab.
_A_TABS_GROUP_IS_VERTICAL_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use is-vertical to arrange the tabs vertically or horizontally. The first two examples demonstrate vertical tabs, while the third shows horizontal tabs.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_ACTIVE_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-active to set the active tab upon component initialization. If the active field in the tab data is set to true, that tab will be active during the initial render.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_CONTENT_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-content to define which field in the data will be used as the content associated with each tab. Instead of the default content key, aloha is used to display the content associated with each tab.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-disabled to disable specific tabs. Tabs with disabled set to true will not be interactive.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_ID_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-id to improve performance during tab rendering. Using a unique identifier for each tab allows faster determination of the active tab. If key-id is not specified, the tab index is used.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-label to specify an alternative field for tab labels. In this case, the name key is used instead of the label key for tab names.
_A_TABS_GROUP_KEY_TITLE_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use key-title to define which data field will be used as the title for the tabs. Instead of the default title, you can use another key, such as label.
_A_TABS_GROUP_STATIC_SLOTS_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use static slots tab and content to customize the tab and content display. Slot arguments provide access to activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
_A_TABS_GROUP_STATIC_SLOTS_HEADER_: Static slots for tabs and content
_A_TABS_GROUP_TITLE_HTML_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use is-title-html to allow HTML content in tab titles. In addition, the key-title property is used to specify the key from which the HTML content for the tab titles is taken.
_A_TABS_LABEL_TITLE_PLACEMENT_: Tooltip position relative to element (titlePlacement)
_A_TABS_PROPS_ACTIVE_TAB_ID_DESCRIPTION_: Defines the ID or index of the active tab. If key-id is not set, the tab index is used. The component tracks changes to this value to update the active tab.
_A_TABS_PROPS_DATA_DESCRIPTION_: The array of data describing the tabs. Each element in the array is an object with properties for the tab's title, content, and other settings.
_A_TABS_PROPS_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION_: Disables tab interaction. If set to true, tabs cannot be switched.
_A_TABS_PROPS_IS_BOXED_DESCRIPTION_: Determines whether the active tab will be surrounded by a border. If set to true, a border will be displayed.
_A_TABS_PROPS_IS_CHANGE_OUTSIDE_DESCRIPT: If set to true, the tab will not change automatically when clicked. You must use the change event to update active-tab-id.
_A_TABS_PROPS_IS_VERTICAL_DESCRIPTION_: Specifies whether the tabs will be arranged vertically or horizontally. If set to true, tabs will be displayed vertically.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_ACTIVE_DESCRIPTION_: Defines the key used to activate a tab when initializing the component. If the field specified by key-active is set to true, the corresponding tab will be activated.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_CONTENT_DESCRIPTION_: Allows specifying the key for the data that will be used as the content for each tab.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION_: Key to disable individual tabs. If the tab's key value is true, the tab will be disabled.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_ID_DESCRIPTION_: Unique identifier for the tabs. If key-id is not specified, the tab index is used.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: Key for specifying the field that will be used for the tab labels.
_A_TABS_PROPS_KEY_TITLE_DESCRIPTION_: Allows specifying the key for the data that will be used for the tab titles.
_A_TABS_SLOTS_CONTENT_DESCRIPTION_: Static slot for customizing the tab's content display. Slot arguments include: activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
_A_TABS_SLOTS_SLOT_CONTENT_DESCRIPTION_: Dynamic slot for customizing the tab's content display. The slot name is specified in the data array for each tab. Slot arguments include: activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
_A_TABS_SLOTS_SLOT_TAB_DESCRIPTION_: Dynamic slot for customizing the tab's display. The slot name is specified in the data array for each tab. Slot arguments include: activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
_A_TABS_SLOTS_TAB_DESCRIPTION_: Static slot for customizing the tab's display. Slot arguments include: activeTabId, contentId, index, isActive, parentId, tab, tabId.
